title: Darwin being promoted through TV show - Travelandtourworld.comTravelandtourworld.com
text:
Darwin being promoted through TV show Published on : Monday, September 14, 2015
Darwin is set to shine into the living rooms of hundreds of thousands of Australians when the TODAY Show broadcasts live from the Darwin Waterfront on Tuesday 29 September.
“It’s going to be fantastic to have Karl, Lisa and the TODAY Show team back in the Top End following their live outside broadcast in Kakadu in May this year,” Chief Minister Adam Giles said.
“The special broadcast has been arranged to coincide with the NT Government’s new national advertising campaign, to promote Darwin called, ‘Darwin – take another look’, which will also be launched next week.
“Darwin has grown over the years into a vibrant and cosmopolitan city, with offerings rivalling that of other capital cities around Australia.
“The TODAY Show broadcast will help us push our message that it’s about time all Australians get to know the real Darwin and ‘take another look’.
“Next week’s broadcast and new Darwin campaign will help increase accommodation and tour bookings throughout the shoulder and low season and is part of the Government’s plan to drive the development of North Australia and build a $2.2 billion visitor economy by 2020.”
The live broadcast will feature pre-filmed segments showcasing the best of Darwin and surrounds.
“Every one of our We Love Australia trips has taken us to the Top End. We just love the NT,” TODAY Show Executive Producer Mark Calvert said.
“We love the welcome we get from the good folk there; we love the amazing scenery and the incredible stories. We can’t wait to hit town.”
The outside broadcast will take place at the Darwin Waterfront from 5.30am-9.30am with hosts Karl Stefanovic, Richard Wilkins and Mate of the Territory, Lisa Wilkinson.
“I encourage all TODAY Show fans to get on down to the Waterfront nice and early next Tuesday to see Karl, Lisa and the TODAY Show team in action right here in beautiful Darwin,” Mr Giles said.
